nodes.text: Bassa Bridge was a man-made bridge constructed by the Naboo as a crossing point of one of the Solleu River's many tributaries.

Built early on in Theed's history, Bassa Bridge was located downstream of the falls that crested over the cliffs of Theed. One of the primary crossings of the Solleu River in the city, the bridge became decrepit over its several hundred year history and was so weakened that Pergola's Bridge was erected upstream to relieve the strain on the older crossing.
